meanings.definition: Given too much information or instruction.
meanings.sent1: She felt overbriefed by the long manual.
meanings.sent2: The students were overbriefed before the exam.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked overbriefed after being taught to fetch.
meanings.sent4: The garden was overbriefed with too many signs.
meanings.sent5: The overbriefed computer screen overwhelmed the user.

meanings.definition: To provide excessive information or instruction.
meanings.sent1: He tends to overbriefed his team members.
meanings.sent2: The teacher overbriefed the students about the project.
meanings.sent3: The chef overbriefed the recipe, making it hard to follow.
meanings.sent4: The news anchor overbriefed the audience with too many details.
meanings.sent5: The manual overbriefed the users, causing confusion.
